snippet: Former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice, who was to speak at the May 18 commencement at Rutgers University, said she did not want to detract from the day’s festivities.
abstract: Former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice, who was to give commencement address at Rutgers University, says she will not give speech; her announcement comes after weeks of protests by some students and faculty members over university's decision to invite her.
lead_paragraph: Former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice, who was to speak at the May 18 commencement at Rutgers University, said she did not want to detract from the day’s festivities.

headline.main: Condoleezza Rice Backs Out of Rutgers Speech After Student Protests
headline.print_headline: Rice Cancels Speech at Rutgers After Student Protests

keywords.value: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
